author: jerenkrantz
msg: If Listen directive is not a port, but just an IP, emit an error condition as
this case is ambiguous.  ('Listen 127.0.0.1' doesn't make any sense.)
(Rich came up with the problem.  Cliff came up with the error text.  Justin
Reviewed by:	Cliff Woolley, Rich Bowen

author: rbowen
msg: PR: Debian Bug report #169431 -- Documentation of AllowOverride strongly
(and wrongly) implies it is valid within a <Location> directive.
This patch corrects that, as you really can't use AllowOverride in Files
